Summary: This hotel is located in the Haidian district, next to the Four Points Hotel, and is not downtown. The location is not ideal for tourists as it is far from historic sites and requires taxi rides.

The Ascott Beijing is located in the Chaoyang District, near the Guo Mao subway stop and the World Trade Center. It offers apartment-style accommodations with kitchens and laundry facilities, suitable for families or groups.

The Autumn Garden Hotel is a traditional-style hotel located in a hutong (maze of alleyways) near Tiananmen Square, offering guests a glimpse into old Beijing. The hotel provides a trishaw service to the main road and is within walking distance of the Qianmen subway station.

The Bamboo Garden Hotel is located in a traditional Hutong neighborhood and housed in a historic building, offering a unique cultural experience. The hotel features Chinese-style decor, tranquil courtyards, and gardens that provide a peaceful escape from the busy city.
Century Towers Beijing offers apartment-style rooms with kitchens, dining areas, and washer/dryers. The hotel is located across the street from a supermarket and includes a workout room.

The Dong Fang Hotel has an older section with a coffee shop named 1918, referencing the original building date. One review mentions walking through "hutongs" and a street market en route to the hotel.

Located in a hutong in old Beijing, the Far East Hotel/Hostel is within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and provides a glimpse into traditional Chinese life. The hostel is situated within Beijing's traditional hutongs which adds to it's character.

The Beijing Friendship Hotel was built in the 1950s with grey brick buildings and Chinese roofs. It was built to support friendship between the Soviets and the Chinese Communists and has a historical significance related to Nixon and Mao.
The hotel is near the US and Japanese embassies and adjacent to a food street. It was recently remodeled before the Olympics.

The Beijing Hotel is a historic hotel, with parts of the building dating back over 100 years, that has hosted dignitaries for nearly a century. It is located near Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City.

The Beijing International Hotel is centrally located near the Beijing Railway Station, within walking distance of Tiananmen Square, Wangfujing Street, and the Forbidden City. Some rooms offer views of the Beijing Railway Station.

The Jade International Youth Hostel is located in the heart of the historic area, within a 10-minute walk of Tiananmen Square and close to the Forbidden City. The breakfast area and reading room are decorated in a traditional style, and guests can try on Emperor/Empress suits for photos.

Sihe Hotel is a small courtyard hotel located in one of Beijing's remaining Hutong's, offering a traditional Chinese experience. The hotel features antique Chinese furnishings, a peaceful courtyard, and is within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Wangfujing Street.
This is a modern, newly built Chinese 5-star hotel with decor and facilities that are Chinese in style. It is located in Beijing's central business district.
The Capital Hotel is within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. Some reviewers mention the hotel's decor as traditional, with marble pillars and walls.
The hotel has live music in the lobby that includes Chinese music. The hotel is near historical sites, such as Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City.

The City Hotel is located near local restaurants catering to foreigners and is close to the subway for access to Tiananmen Square, the Forbidden City, and the Military Museum. The hotel is also next door to several pubs.
The Commune by the Great Wall is located in a valley next to the Great Wall and offers private access to an unrestored section of the Wall. The hotel consists of villas designed by Asian architects.

Courtyard 7 is a renovated courtyard hotel in the old part of Beijing, located in the hutongs near the Bell and Drum Towers. It features traditional Chinese courtyard architecture, with rooms furnished in a traditional style, and is located near historical sites such as the Forbidden City.
This hotel review does not contain information about a historical or cultural atmosphere. The reviews focus on its location and cleanliness.

Many reviewers mention the hotel's modern style and newness, as well as its location near major attractions in Beijing. However, the reviews do not highlight any specific cultural or historical atmosphere within the hotel itself.

The hotel is located within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. Some reviewers mention the hotel's proximity to historical sites and cultural experiences such as the night food market.
The hotel is located near Summer Palace, Peking University, and Tsinghua University. The subway provides access to Forbidden Palace and Tiananmen Square.

This hotel is located near the airport and exhibition center, in an industrial area far from central Beijing. There is little to see in the surroundings, and taxi rides to the city center can take 40 minutes to over an hour.
The hotel is near the Olympic Park, Bird's Nest stadium and Water Cube swimming arena, about 30-45 minutes by taxi to the Forbidden City. There are restaurants and shops within a 5-10 minute walk.

The hotel has a Yunnan theme, and two Chinese restaurants are available, one featuring Yunan cuisine and the other Cantonese seafood. The breakfast buffet offers Chinese options alongside Western and Japanese choices.
Days Inn Forbidden City is located near the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, and next to a Hutong. The hotel is within walking distance of a park where locals exercise in the morning.

This modern hotel has clean rooms with flat-screen TVs, but its location is not near many attractions or an underground station. The hotel's atmosphere doesn't feel particularly Chinese, and it could resemble a hotel in Tucson.

The Double Happiness Courtyard Hotel is a traditional Chinese courtyard hotel located in a hutong (alleyway), featuring rooms decorated with traditional Chinese furniture and arranged around inner courtyards. The hotel is situated in a historic neighborhood with local shops and restaurants, offering an authentic cultural experience.

The hotel is located in the Xuan Wu District, a long historical district of downtown Beijing, and is just outside the 2nd Ring Road on a main avenue. Some reviewers noted the location was not close to major sites, but near bus stops.

The Empark Grand Hotel is located in the northwest part of the city, a 20-30 minute taxi ride to the city center and historical attractions like Tiananmen Square. There is an underground "city" beneath the hotel with restaurants, boutiques, and spas.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not contain information that would suggest a cultural or historical atmosphere. The reviews focus on amenities, service, and location.
The hotel is located near the Embassy area and within walking distance of the Forbidden City. Some rooms offer a view of an ancient tower with astronomy tools and the old Beijing city wall.

The Grand Hotel is described as an old, traditional hotel with Chinese-style furniture and decor, some rooms having views of the Forbidden City. The hotel features cultural artifacts such as a Great Wall carving from an elephant tusk and chairs resembling Ming Dynasty stools.

The Grand Hyatt Beijing is conveniently located near the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square, and Wangfujing shopping street. Some reviewers mention walking to the Forbidden City, being a 15-20 minute walk.
I am sorry, but there is nothing from this document that I can use to fulfill this request. There is no mention of a "strong cultural or historical atmosphere."
I am sorry, but this hotel is described as modern, located in the financial district, and near the CCTV building, which does not align well with the cultural or historical atmosphere.
The Grand View Garden Hotel has a Chinese architectural style and a traditional flair. It provides access to a garden based on the Chinese classic "The Dream of the Red Mansion".
The Guangzhou Hotel is located near Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, and is close to the subway and the Xidan shopping area. Some reviewers mention that the hotel is an older building.

The Harmony Hotel is near the Beijing Railway Station and subway, within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. It is also close to local shops, restaurants, and hutongs (traditional alleyways).

The Hebei Hotel is a courtyard hotel located in a traditional hutong (narrow lane in a local neighborhood) within walking distance of the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square, and other attractions. The hotel has multiple buildings, some with courtyards and suites, offering a more authentic experience of old Beijing.
I'm sorry, but this hotel is not particularly known for its cultural or historical atmosphere. Although it is near the Forbidden City, the reviews focus on the modern ammenities.

The hotel is located in the center of Beijing, within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, and close to the Wangfujing shopping district. The hotel is near historical sites and maintains old forms in houses and shops.
The Holiday Inn Lido is the first Holiday Inn property in China and has been around since the 1980s. It is located near the airport but not close to tourist sights.

The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood, offering a glimpse into the local Beijing lifestyle, and is near the Temple of Heaven. Some reviewers recommend visiting the drum tower of Beijing neighborhood and Nan Luogu Xiang, Beijing to find shops and restaurants in the heart of hutongs.
The hotel's Executive Floor features a study decorated with age-old china and books about Chinese culture. It is located in an old residential district.

The hotel building is quite old and basic, though some rooms have been renovated. It is located on the northwest edge of the second ring road, not far from the zoo and close to a subway station for access to Tiananmen Square.
The hotel is near the Ethnic Minority People's Park, and a converted mosque that is now an outlet mall. It is located in a traditional Chinese area, with a Chinatown shopping center nearby.

The Holiday Inn Express Temple of Heaven is located near the Temple of Heaven, and within walking distance of the Tianqiao Acrobatics theatre and TianQian cultural theatre. It is also located about a 5-10 minute taxi ride to the Temple of Heaven.

The hotel is located near the Focus Mall and Stellar International Cineplex, which has approximately 20 restaurants, a liquor store, and a department store with a supermarket. It is not far from tourist sites if using public transport, about an hour to Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City.

The Holiday Inn Temple of Heaven is located near the Temple of Heaven and within walking distance of it, situated in a normal residential area of Beijing. The hotel provides easy access to local life and culture, with nearby grocery stores and pastry shops.

The hotel caters mainly to Asian guests, with limited English-speaking staff, and is located in an area with ongoing construction. The breakfast offers the same food choices daily, and there were reported issues with the hotel attempting to charge extra fees upon checkout.

Hotel Cote Cour SL is a small, restored Chinese courtyard hotel located in a traditional hutong in central Beijing, offering guests a glimpse into old Beijing. The hotel's location provides an authentic experience, and it is decorated with Chinese antiques and modern art.
The hotel has modern and trendy design with colorful lights on the windows, but reviewers do not mention any cultural or historical atmosphere. The hotel is near the Sanlitun area.

Ibis Sanyuan Hotel is located near the Sanyuanqiao subway station, the first stop from the airport via the Airport Express train. The hotel is situated in the Chaoyang district, close to the Lufthansa Center, but a bit away from major attractions and central sights, though easily accessible by subway.

The Kunlun Hotel features a revolving restaurant on the 29th floor and is noted by one reviewer to be furnished in an old-fashioned style, needing re-decoration. The hotel is described as a place where Shanghai business people stay.
The New Otani is a Japanese-style hotel with a Japanese garden and thematic Japanese restaurants. It is centrally located on Chang An Avenue, close to Tien An Men Square and the Forbidden City.

The hotel is located across from the Beijing train station, and within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. The hotel is connected to a shopping mall with direct access to a subway station.

This hotel is near the Lufthansa Centre, Sanlitun bar Street, and embassy districts, and offers easy access to the airport and the Agriculture Exhibition Centre. It is not the most modern of hotels, with corridor carpets that may need renewal.

I am sorry, but the hotel reviews for the Hua Wei Business Appartment Hotel do not contain information that suggests that it has a strong cultural or historical atmosphere. The hotel is centrally located in a busy shopping district near the Xidan subway station.

The Intercontinental Beijing Beichen is located near the Olympic Green, offering views of the Bird's Nest and Water Cube. Some reviewers noted the breakfast buffet included a wide selection of Asian foods like dumplings and Chinese pasta.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention cultural or historical characteristics of this hotel. The hotel is modern and located in the financial district.

The Jade Garden Hotel is a historic building that was completely renovated less than 10 years ago and has an interesting history as a guesthouse during the Long March and later became a headquarters for some Communist leaders.
The hotel is located near the Silk Market and close to the subway, with access to Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. Some rooms have views of a traditional Chinese garden.

The Qianmen Hotel features a Beijing Opera theme, with operas performed nightly in its in-house theatre, and is housed in a building that is approximately 50 years old, possibly of historical significance. It is located in a regular Chinese neighborhood, near the Qianmen Quanjude Roast Duck Restaurant and Tiananmen Square.

The Jinqiao Hotel Apartments is located a 10-minute drive from the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. While the hotel itself does not have a strong cultural atmosphere, it is close to major historical attractions and about a half-hour walk to the Temple of Heaven.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews contain information about cultural or historical aspects of the Joy City Hotel. The reviews focus on the hotel's cleanliness, location, and amenities.

The JW Marriott Beijing is a modern hotel located near the CBD, close to a subway stop that provides access to the Forbidden City and other major sites, though it is not located downtown. Some reviewers noted the surrounding area lacks an authentic "Chinese" feel, resembling more of a modern shopping district.

The Kapok Hotel is located near the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, offering convenient access to historical sites. Some reviewers mention the hotel is located in an authentic Chinese neighborhood, near hutongs (traditional alleyways), offering a glimpse into local life.

Kelly's Courtyard is located in a hutong area and is a transformed siheyuan (courtyard house) blending traditional elements with modern comforts. It features a glass-covered courtyard, chinoiserie decor, and a roof terrace.
The Kempinski Lufthansa Center has a German-themed bar, Paulaner, serving German food and beer. The hotel also has a Chinese restaurant, Dragon Palace, serving traditional food.
The hotel is located across the street from the Tao Temple/Cultural Center. It is also a short walk from Yashow Market, which some reviewers preferred over the Silk Market.
Lee Gardens Service Apartment is located within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. It is also close to the Wangfujing shopping street and night market.
The Legendale Hotel in Beijing has a French classic style and an indoor pool resembling an antique Roman pool. It is located a 15-20 minute walk from the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.
The Loong Palace is located near the Great Wall and Ming Tombs, with the Great Wall visible on a clear day. The hotel is decorated for Christmas and features a staircase in the lobby.

The hotel is located in the embassy area and near the Friendship Store, with a subway stop about 1/4 mile away. The hotel hosted a free party to celebrate the Moon Festival, an important celebration in Chinese culture.

The Marco Polo Parkside is located near the Bird's Nest Olympic Stadium and Olympic Park, about 30 minutes by taxi from the city center. The hotel is situated across the street from a supermarket and close to banks and a McDonalds.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention any cultural or historical atmosphere at this hotel. The reviews focus on the hotel's amenities, service, and location.
The hotel is located in the Chaoyang district and is near the Sandalwood museum. It is a 30-40 minute taxi ride to the Forbidden City.

The hotel is located near the Beijing railway station and subway, and adjacent to a park with remnants of the "city wall". Some reviewers mention its proximity to historical sights, though a taxi ride is necessary to reach them.

I am sorry, but none of the reviews indicate that the hotel has a strong cultural or historical atmosphere. Most of the reviews focus on the hotel's cleanliness, helpful staff, and modern amenities, but do not mention anything about cultural or historical elements.

Michael's House is an authentic Chinese Courtyard hotel located in a hutong, offering a traditional atmosphere with rooms decorated in a traditional style. The hotel is a refurbished, nearly 100-year-old courtyard home, providing guests with a glimpse into real Beijing neighborhood life.

Located near the Wangfujing shopping area, this hotel is within walking distance of the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square, and the Dong Hua Men night food market. The Dengshikou subway station is also a short walk away.
The hotel is one of the original 5-star hotels in Beijing and has been completely refurbished. It is located near the Chaoyang Theater and within a 15-minute subway ride to Tiananmen Square.

Many reviewers mention that the hotel's decor and public areas appear dated, with one reviewer describing the deco as a "rewind to the early 90's." One review mentions taking a tour from the hotel that included a visit to a Chinese home and studio.
The hotel is located within walking distance of the Forbidden City. Some reviewers mentioned seeing Hutongs from their windows.
The hotel is located within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. Some reviews mention that the hotel shows its age and is an older building, though renovated.

The Oakwood Residence Beijing offers large, comfortable apartments with fully equipped kitchens and laundry facilities. It is centrally located on the Eastern 3rd ring of the city, near modern shopping malls and restaurants, but not within walking distance to landmarks.
The hotel is located near the Olympic stadium, a 15-20 minute walk to the Birds Nest. The hotel is also located 5 minutes walking distance to the MRT station.

The Oriental Bay International Hotel is located near a metro station providing easy access to central Beijing and attractions such as the Lama Temple. Some reviewers mention walking towards the Bell Tower and Hutong area to experience local nightlife, bars, and restaurants.
The hotel is located close to the Lama Temple and Confucius Temple and is near a subway station. The hotel has a fountain, piano, and palm trees in the lobby.

The hotel boasts a garden complex next door free to hotel guests, which serves as a central point for locals' morning exercises like Tai Chi and Badminton. The hotel has a unique "Old World" ambience with dark wood characteristic of Chinese design.

The hotel is located within the Palm Springs apartment complex, near a restaurant in Chaoyang Park that was formerly a royal residence. The front desk has business cards with addresses written in Mandarin for taxi drivers.

The Park Hyatt Beijing features sleek, modern interior design with a slight oriental touch. Some reviewers felt that the hotel's decor was sterile and did not leverage the rich history of Chinese art.

I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention that this hotel has a strong cultural or historical atmosphere. However, the hotel is within walking distance to the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, and has some rooms with views of courtyard houses.
The hotel is owned and run by the police department. It is located about 15 minutes by taxi from the city center.

The hotel is near an area with Beijing's disappearing hutongs and a local market, offering a glimpse into older, traditional Beijing. The hotel provides cards for taxi drivers to take guests to cultural sites.

The Prime Hotel is located near the Forbidden City and other major attractions, offering a convenient base for exploring Beijing's historical sites. Some rooms offer views of the Forbidden City rooftops.

I am sorry, but there is no information about the cultural or historical atmosphere of this hotel in the reviews. The reviews focus on the newness, cleanliness, and value of the hotel, as well as its distance from the city center.
The hotel's interior design reminded one reviewer of the 1980s in Beijing. It is located a 10-minute walk from the Lama and Confucian temples, and the Imperial Academy.

Raffles Beijing is located near historic sites like Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, with some rooms in the original building featuring old English-style decor and Ming Dynasty pieces. The hotel provides bedtime stories on the pillow and jogging maps for the area.

The Renaissance Beijing Capital Hotel is a modern hotel built in 2008 for the Olympics, located in the Chaoyang District close to the Central Business District and the 3rd Ring Road. It is near a subway station and a shopping mall, but not within walking distance of historical sights.

The hotel is located outside the main downtown area in a neighborhood setting, offering a more meaningful experience of Chinese culture with local restaurants and shops. The hotel is near the embassy district, which has a large ex-pat scene.

The hotel has a Chinese garden and offers Chinese cuisine at Shang Palace restaurant. Some reviewers felt the hotel had a "global" feel and lacked a distinct sense of place, while others appreciated the garden as a respite from the city.

I'm sorry, but none of the reviews mention a strong cultural or historical atmosphere at this hotel. The reviews focus on its location in the CBD, modern amenities, and suitability for business travelers.

The Shatan Hotel is located in a traditional Beijing hutong, offering a glimpse into local life and is a short walk from the Forbidden City and Jingshan Park. Some reviewers note the hotel's location provides an authentic Chinese experience, with small shops, restaurants, and markets nearby.
I am sorry, but the provided hotel reviews do not contain information about the hotel's cultural or historical atmosphere. The hotel is described as modern and luxurious.

The Soluxe Courtyard Hotel has the charm of old Chinese houses and is located in a hutong, allowing guests to wander through traditional alleyways. It is close to the Drum and Bell Tower, and the surrounding area is quiet and pleasant to walk in.

The Somerset ZhongGuanCun is located in the Haidian district, a 15-minute ride from the Summer Palace, and close to subway line 10, which provides access to the Olympic Park. Reviews mention its proximity to public transportation and convenience stores.

The Spring Garden Hotel is a small, traditional courtyard-style hotel located in the hutong area of Beijing, featuring antique reproductions, classic Chinese furniture, and decor that reflects old Beijing. The 800-year-old building is restored to provide modern comforts while maintaining the ambiance and sereneness of ancient Chinese Hutong life.

I am sorry, but the reviews do not mention the hotel having any kind of strong cultural or historical atmosphere. The reviews focus on the hotel's location near shopping and tourist attractions, cleanliness, and value for money.

The Swissotel Beijing is located near the subway and cultural attractions like the Poly Theater and Acrobatics show theater. Some reviewers mention the hotel's proximity to areas with renovated old grain houses now used as restaurants.

Templeside Deluxe Hutong House is located in a traditional Beijing Hutong neighborhood, offering an authentic experience of everyday life in the city. The hotel is an old family home with a central courtyard, providing a cultural atmosphere.

The Aman at Summer Palace is located in a historical residence at the gate of the Summer Palace, offering a spiritual experience and a private entrance to the palace grounds. The property incorporates buildings that were guest houses for visitors to the Summer Palace during the Qing dynasty.
The Emperor Hotel has rooms named after Chinese Emperors and is located close to the Forbidden City. The hotel is situated in a narrow lane in an old part of Beijing near local hutongs.

The Opposite House is a modern, design-focused hotel located in the Sanlitun district, near bars, restaurants, and shops. While the hotel itself is modern, some reviewers mention that the hotel can arrange tours of older neighborhoods.

The Peninsula Beijing, formerly known as the Palace Hotel, is described as an older, grand hotel with a slightly old-fashioned sense of luxury. Some reviewers mention the hotel's proximity to the Forbidden City and historical sites like Tiananmen Square.

I'm sorry, but none of the reviews mention cultural or historical aspects of the Regent Beijing. The hotel is modern, but it is within walking distance of the Forbidden City and other historical areas.

The hotel is located near a major street close to Tiananmen Square, the Forbidden City, and the Silk Market. The decor of the hotel in general is "east-meets-west" and done in a tasteful and subtle manner.
The Ritz-Carlton Beijing has a traditional, European-style decor, with touches of Chinoiserie. It is located near the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, and close to the Dawanglu subway stop.
The St. Regis Beijing has hints of Chinese culture in its modern and cosmopolitan decor. Some reviewers mention its location near embassies and historical sites like Tienanmen Square.
The hotel is located near the Lufthansa Center and a metro stop which provides transport to different parts of the city. A Hard Rock Cafe is within walking distance.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention any cultural or historical atmosphere at this hotel. Most of the reviews focus on the quality of service, facilities, and food.

The Tianlun Dynasty Hotel is located near historical sites like the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, with some rooms offering views of the Forbidden City. The hotel features a central atrium with evening music, aiming to provide a haven from Beijing street life.
Located in a traditional Chinese Hutong, the hotel is situated on a narrow alley, offering a quiet environment. It is also located near other hutongs where ordinary Beijing folks live.

The Tiantan Hotel is located near the Temple of Heaven and the Red Theater, and within walking distance of the Pearl Market. The hotel also has a Rainbow Cafe restaurant that serves a mix of American and Chinese cuisine.

Traders Hotel is located near the Forbidden City and other historical monuments, as well as traditional Chinese buildings. The hotel is situated between the 3rd and 4th ring in Beijing, convenient to the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.
This modern business hotel is located in Beijing's new business district, between the airport and city center. It is not near tourist attractions or the subway.
The hotel is located near the Forbidden City and other cultural sights, with some rooms offering views of the Forbidden City. The hotel is near the Wangfujing shopping district and night market.

I am sorry, none of the reviews mention the cultural or historical atmosphere of the hotel. They do mention its proximity to universities and the availability of Korean and Japanese dining options, reflecting a local culture influenced by international students.
The hotel is located within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, about 25 minutes away. It is also near Wangfujing shopping street and surrounded by local restaurants.

Xinyuan Inn is located in a modern, touristy hutong, offering a more authentic Chinese travel experience with smaller, traditionally styled rooms. The hotel is within walking distance of sights, with good bus access, and near a traditional Chinese breakfast restaurant.

The XiXI Youyi Hotel is located a mile west of Tiananmen Square and a 10-minute walk from the Xidan subway station in one of the city's main shopping districts. The hotel is near the Xidan shopping center.

The Xiyuan Hotel is described as a large hotel that may have been very good in the past but is now showing its age, with some rooms described as tired or dated. It has a connection to Chinese government offices and may reflect an older style of service.
The hotel is located in Haidan (University District) near Beijing Jiatong University, frequented mostly by Chinese conference attendees. Local restaurants near the hotel cater to students.

The Zhong An Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a glimpse into traditional Beijing living, and is within walking distance of historical sites like Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. The hotel's location near the Beijing Railway Station provides convenient access to transportation for exploring the city.
